meanings.definition: Relating to or affected by hypothermia.
meanings.sent1: The hypothermic patient was shivering uncontrollably.
meanings.sent2: The doctor quickly wrapped the hypothermic patient in warm blankets.
meanings.sent3: The penguin joked that he was feeling hypothermic after swimming in the cold water for too long.
meanings.sent4: The icy wind made me feel hypothermic, even though it was just a chilly day.
meanings.sent5: The image of the hypothermic explorer stuck in my mind, reminding me to always dress warmly in winter.

meanings.definition: Having a body temperature below normal.
meanings.sent1: The hypothermic cat curled up next to the fireplace to warm up.
meanings.sent2: The hiker became hypothermic after getting caught in the snowstorm.
meanings.sent3: The hypothermic popsicle refused to melt in the summer heat.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt hypothermic, cold and distant from the recent betrayal.
meanings.sent5: The hypothermic sensation crept through her body, causing her teeth to chatter uncontrollably.
